post_text:
On January 12th, the NJ Dept of Ed approved Ridge and Valley Charter School, a K-8 Warren County school, for an additional five years of student instruction (through 2023).

As one of the original charter schools in NJ, RVCS has been recognized as an "Innovative Charter School" through an emphasis on student-centered curriculum, personal excellence, hands-on experiential education, ecological sustainability, earth literacy, bioregional studies, self-directed study and outdoor learning. Ridge and Valley is pleased to continue offering high-quality educational experiences to students in NJ. Click to learn more.

http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/2018/02/13/ridge-and-valley-charter-school-approved-through-2023/

post_text:
Ridge and Valley Charter School recently attended the New Jersey Charter School Association's annual conference in October which celebrated the 20 year anniversary of charter schools in New Jersey. RVCS was highlighted throughout the conference through inclusion in their slideshow as well as an invitation to participate on a panel of schools with sustainability as their focus.

Dillon Uzar, a 2007 graduate of Ridge and Valley Charter School, was asked to give a speech as the “Alumni Representative” at the evening banquet of festivities. He proudly described how his education at Ridge and Valley Charter School shaped him as a person and helped him thrive academically.
shared_text:
RIDGEANDVALLEY.ORG
Ridge & Valley Charter School Featured at Recent New Jersey Charter School Association Conference - Ridge and Valley Charter School
text:
Ridge and Valley Charter School recently attended the New Jersey Charter School Association's annual conference in October which celebrated the 20 year anniversary of charter schools in New Jersey. RVCS was highlighted throughout the conference through inclusion in their slideshow as well as an invitation to participate on a panel of schools with sustainability as their focus.

Dillon Uzar, a 2007 graduate of Ridge and Valley Charter School, was asked to give a speech as the “Alumni Representative” at the evening banquet of festivities. He proudly described how his education at Ridge and Valley Charter School shaped him as a person and helped him thrive academically.

RIDGEANDVALLEY.ORG

post_text:
Ridge and Valley Charter School was one of just four charter schools out of 89 in the state of New Jersey to be featured in the New Jersey Charter School Association’s “20 Years of New Jersey Charter Schools: A State of the Sector Report” under the “Innovation Stories” section. The report concludes that “Ridge and Valley is an innovative school that truly embodies its unique mission – providing students with a high-quality education for a hopeful, sustainable future.”

http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/2017/11/08/rvcs-innovative-high-performing-new-jersey-charter-school-in-njcsa-report/

post_text:
Ridge and Valley Charter School is a tuition-free public K-8 school of choice. Our educational program and curriculum honors children as individuals and emphasizes personal excellence, hands-on experiential education, self-directed and outdoor learning, project-based learning, earth literacy, bioregional studies – all in the context of our 13.7 billion-year-old Universe.

Want to Learn More? RSVP for our next Information Night on Thursday, October 5th, 2017 at 7 p.m. by calling Jen Ross @ 908-362-1114

http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/2017/09/25/a-unique-tier-1-charter-school-in-new-jersey-ridge-and-valley-charter-school/

If you are looking for a unique and enriching educational experience for your child this fall, consider Ridge and Valley Charter School -- a tuition-free public school of choice open to any NJ child K-8, with a mission of ecological literacy and sustainability. It is not too late to apply for the upcoming school year. Visit our website for more information on how to enroll.

http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/enrollment/

post_text: It is a Ridge and Valley Charter School tradition that the oldest and youngest students in the school become partners and get together a few times each month to deepen their connection with RVCS mission, culture, and one another. The eighth graders and their kindergarten partners recently hiked together to the Paulinskill River to practice hiking safety and hike leadership skills.
text: It is a Ridge and Valley Charter School tradition that the oldest and youngest students in the school become partners and get together a few times each month to deepen their connection with RVCS mission, culture, and one another. The eighth graders and their kindergarten partners recently hiked together to the Paulinskill River to practice hiking safety and hike leadership skills.

Overnight expeditionary experiences offer some of the most important and exciting opportunities to students. Not only are these experiences critical in the development of self-confidence and a love of the natural world, but they also provide a rich, integrated way to learn and apply the skills and knowledge that our students are studying throughout the year. Read more on our latest post!

post_text: The school year is off to a great start. Students have been outside every day learning, exploring and enjoying the beautiful school grounds that serve as a magical outdoor classroom.
text: The school year is off to a great start. Students have been outside every day learning, exploring and enjoying the beautiful school grounds that serve as a magical outdoor classroom.

post_text: After learning about watersheds throughout the school year, Ridge and Valley Charter School student volunteers were compelled to plant 163 trees on the banks of the Paulins Kill in Stillwater, New Jersey to mitigate invasive species that prevent reforestation. The story was featured in the NJ Herald! Learn more on our latest blog http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/community/students-volunteer-to-plant-trees-on-paulinskill/ #servicelearning #projectbasedlearning #experientialeducation
shared_text:
RIDGEANDVALLEY.ORG
Student Volunteers Plant Trees on Paulins Kill - Ridge & Valley Charter School - Ridge and Valley Charter School
text:
After learning about watersheds throughout the school year, Ridge and Valley Charter School student volunteers were compelled to plant 163 trees on the banks of the Paulins Kill in Stillwater, New Jersey to mitigate invasive species that prevent reforestation. The story was featured in the NJ Herald! Learn more on our latest blog http://www.ridgeandvalley.org/community/students-volunteer-to-plant-trees-on-paulinskill/ #servicelearning #projectbasedlearning #experientialeducation

shared_text:
RIDGEANDVALLEY.ORG

post_text:
On a recent trip to Mohican Outdoor Center students learned how to use a pump-style water purification system to provide safe drinking water when out in the wilderness. Students also hiked the Appalachian Trail, camped overnight and cooked their own food for the trip. This was part of the outdoor expeditionary curriculum that is integral to the mission of the school.
www.ridgeandvalley.org

post_text: At Ridge and Valley Charter School all food waste is composted and used in the school's organic garden and orchard. Students take an active role in tending to the compost pile while learning about decomposition and the use of compost to increase soil structure and fertility.
text: At Ridge and Valley Charter School all food waste is composted and used in the school's organic garden and orchard. Students take an active role in tending to the compost pile while learning about decomposition and the use of compost to increase soil structure and fertility.

post_text: Spring inspires Ridge and Valley students to study and explore the many habitats on the school's 16-acre campus. Here 1st grade students are learning to identify macroinvertebrates that inhabit the nearby creek. They are also studying about pollution intolerant species and how to determine the health of the creek. These students are looking forward to exploring the waters soon to see what they can find.
text: Spring inspires Ridge and Valley students to study and explore the many habitats on the school's 16-acre campus. Here 1st grade students are learning to identify macroinvertebrates that inhabit the nearby creek. They are also studying about pollution intolerant species and how to determine the health of the creek. These students are looking forward to exploring the waters soon to see what they can find.

post_text:
"April showers bring May flowers" but did you ever wonder where all the rainwater goes? At Ridge and Valley Charter School stormwater runoff is managed in a sustainable way through an onsite rain garden in collaboration with Rutgers University's "Green Infrastructure for Sustainable Communities" initiative. Green infrastructures, such as rain gardens, are a cost-effective, low maintenance method of managing stormwater runoff. Learn more about how Ridge and Valley Charter School is supporting this sustainable ecological practice at:
http://water.rutgers.edu/Research/Research.html#green

Using the Columbia University Teachers College Reading and Writing Project as a foundation for teaching balanced literacy, reading workshops are structured to allow individual reading time each day and encourage students to become skilled readers, writers, and investigators.

post_text: Overnight expeditions are an integral part of the Ridge and Valley Charter School experience. Here 8th grade students plan their upcoming 4 day expedition on the Appalachian Trail. RVCS graduates often describe this trip as one of the most significant moments of their educational experience. Expeditions not only build on outdoor skills but also foster confidence, team building, and in-depth research and planning skills.

post_text: Do you know where your garbage ends up? Ridge and Valley Charter School students do! They recently visisted SCMUA (Sussex County Municipal Utilities Authority) and toured the recycling and landfill areas as well as the natural gas plant. They were also the first students to tour the methane burning facility, as part of their unit on renewable energy, since it opened 5 years ago. #ReduceReuseRecycle #RenewableEnergy

shared_text:
Deeptime Network
November 20, 2015 at 9:39 AM ·

Drawing the Big Bang in 4th and 5th Grade!

Ridge & Valley Charter School (Blairstown, NJ) students made these pictures, and many more, in a unit that included reading Born With a Bang by DTJN president Jennifer Morgan. The R&V curriculum is inspired by the work of Thomas Berry, Brian Swimme, and Genesis Farm, also in Blairstown and founded by Miriam MacGillis.

What kinds of deep time artwork are your students creating?
www.deeptimejourney.org

post_text:
For the past 6 years veteran Ridge and Valley Charter School teacher, Bradley White, has facilitated the year-long Trout in the Classroom project with students. This valuable learning experience has applications in science, social studies, mathematics, language arts, fine arts, and physical education. Congrats to Guide Bradley and his students for their great work!

http://www.troutintheclassroom.org/

Ridge and Valley Charter School teacher, Lisa Masi, was one of just 14 educational leaders from around the country to be chosen for the prestigious Education for Sustainability Leadership Academy at Shelburne Farms. post_text:
Friends of RVCS: Tomorrow is our 2015 fundraiser. It's a gathering with dinner, music and dance - and an online auction.

Come join us! If you can't join, don't miss out on the bidding at the auction...

https://www.biddingforgood.com/auction/auctionhome.action?vhost=rvlc

Browse around, find things you like, and bid! The funds help RVCS bring your kids the experiential learning and outdoor programming that are fundamental to our mission.

So not surprisingly, the event and auction theme is "Choose Your Own Adventure!" Most of the items for bid are experiences, rather than merchandise. Come look, bid, support RVCS, and in the process give yourself a new learning experience.

https://www.biddingforgood.com/auction/auctionhome.action?vhost=rvlc

Browse around, find things you like, and bid! The funds help RVCS bring your kids the experiential learning and outdoor programming that are fundamental to our mission.

So not surprisingly, the event and auction theme is "Choose Your Own Adventure!" Most of the items for bid are experiences, rather than merchandise. Come look, bid, support RVCS, and in the process give yourself a new learning experience.

WWW.BIDDINGFORGOOD.COM
Ridge and Valley Learning Circles - BiddingForGood Fundraising Auction
